metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1705 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 33.0.1750.152 on OS X and Linux and before 33.0.1750.154 on Windows, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-chromedriver - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0.1750.152-0ubuntu1~pkg995.1').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
